intro: Stellaria subumbellata f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy starwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters that resemble umbels, contributing to its common name. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. This species is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland edges and stream banks.
